body_html: One of them is added to the linear transform of the input, another one to the hidden transform. It's redundant - there could be only one bias, and the model would be equivalent. However, that's what cuDNN does, so we preferred to keep it like that for consistency.
body_text: One of them is added to the linear transform of the input, another one to the hidden transform. It's redundant - there could be only one bias, and the model would be equivalent. However, that's what cuDNN does, so we preferred to keep it like that for consistency.
body: One of them is added to the linear transform of the input, another one to the hidden transform. It's redundant - there could be only one bias, and the model would be equivalent. However, that's what cuDNN does, so we preferred to keep it like that for consistency.
